content:
The awareness of that "brief span of time" is instantaneous and present, but after that what you're describing is not really related to self-realization, but more a of scientific question. I imagine it is likely related to our working memory being a short "pulse" of experience rather than just "exactly this nano-second". Similar to how dreams occur in short, flow-state bursts and you never questions "yeah why am I here, doing this???". 

That aside, the "now" appears as a brief span of time as a function of memory in the brain, but the awareness of that brief span of time is always instantaneous, which is the "Now" being referred to.
